contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} '''Nemours Jean Baptiste''' (February 2, 1918 – May 18, 1985) was a [[Haiti]]an saxophonist, writer, and band leader.<ref>"Nemours Jeans Bapiste founder of haitian konpa." http://heritagekonpa.com/archives/nemourJnBaptiste.htm. Accessed 9 February 2012</ref> He is credited with being the inventor of ''[[Compas music|compas]]'', a style of Haitian music.<ref>"Nemours Jean Baptise." http://www.allaboutjazz.com/php/musician.php?id=19714. Accessed 9 February 2012.</ref> ==Rivalry with Wéber Sicot== During Nemours Jean Baptiste's early career, he played in a band with fellow Haitian artist [[Webert Sicot]] called Conjunto International. Years after the band dissolved, Webert Sicot introduced a new dance rhythm that bore many similarities to Jean Baptiste's ''[[Compas music|compas]]''. During the period of argument and controversy that followed, the two took lyrical jabs at each other in their songs. The competition between the two culminated in a soccer match between the two artists and their respective bands, which ended in a 1-1 tie.<ref>"Nemours, Jean Baptiste and Sicot, Wéber." http://www2.oxfordaasc.com/article/opr/t0002/e2880. Accessed 9 February 2012.</ref> ==References== <references/> {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Jean Baptiste, Nemours | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Haitian saxophonist | DATE OF BIRTH = February 2, 1918 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = May 18, 1985 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jean Baptiste, Nemours}} [[Category:Haitian musicians]] [[Category:1918 births]] [[Category:1985 deaths]] {{Haiti-bio-stub}} {{Conductor-stub}}
